questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a surrogate key?

options.B: It is generated by the database system.
options.D: It is used to encode data.

questions.question: In database normalization, what is the main goal of the First Normal Form (1NF)?

options.B: Ensure that all attributes are atomic.

questions.question: Which RAID level provides both mirroring and striping?

options.B: RAID level 2

questions.question: What is the purpose of a database trigger?

options.A: To automatically perform an action in response to a specific event.
options.B: To create a new table in the database.
options.C: To index the columns of a table.

questions.question: In a relational database, which clause is used to filter records in a query?

options.B: GROUP BY

questions.question: What is the primary key in a relational database table?

options.A: A key that is used for foreign key references
options.B: A key that is automatically generated by the database system
options.C: A unique identifier for each record in the table
options.D: A key that can have duplicate values

questions.question: Which of the following SQL commands is used to add a new column to an existing table?

options.B: ALTER TABLE

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'GROUP BY' clause in an SQL query?

options.B: To group rows with similar values and perform aggregate functions
options.C: To filter rows based on a condition

questions.question: Which of the following is not an aggregate function in SQL?

options.B: SUM

questions.question: What is referential integrity in the context of databases?

options.B: Ensuring that foreign keys match primary keys in related tables
options.C: Ensuring that tables are fully normalized
options.D: Ensuring that data is stored in sorted order

questions.question: What is a view in a relational database?

options.A: A virtual table that is based on the result of a query
options.B: A physical table that stores data

questions.question: Which SQL clause is used to specify the order in which rows should appear in the result set?

options.B: GROUP BY

questions.question: In the context of normalization, what is a partial dependency?

options.A: A dependency in which one non-key attribute determines another non-key attribute
options.B: A dependency in which a non-key attribute determines the entire key
options.C: A dependency in which a key attribute determines a non-key attribute
options.D: A dependency in which one key attribute determines another key attribute

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a one-to-many relationship in a relational database?

options.A: Each customer can have multiple orders
options.B: Each employee has one department
options.D: Each student can enroll in multiple courses

questions.question: What is the purpose of indexing in a database?

options.B: To optimize query performance by speeding up data retrieval

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to remove data from a database table?

options.B: DROP

questions.question: What does ACID stand for in the context of database transactions?

options.B: Association, Control, Indexing, Data

questions.question: What is the purpose of a foreign key in a database?

options.A: To uniquely identify records in a table
options.B: To ensure data integrity by enforcing referential constraints
options.C: To create indexes for faster data retrieval

questions.question: What is a stored procedure in SQL?

options.B: A predefined sequence of SQL statements that can be executed as a single unit

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to delete an entire table from a database?

options.B: DROP TABLE
